Reviews.Content: Bespoke service at the Regency Just returned from a two night stay in the Regency. What a pleasure it was - from our first meeting with the concierge, to staff advice on how to get to the airport when we left, our 48 hours there were a delight. We stayed in one of the smaller rooms, overlooking the front of the hotel and the park. The queen size bed was very comfortable, and the antique table and chairs were a nice touch. The marble bathroom had a fantastic monsoon shower plus bath, both of which were much appreciated after long days wandering around the sights of Florence. The turndown service was especially appreciated after nights out with friends - coming back to the bedroom bathed in gentle golden light, slippers laid out on each side of the bed and a card telling us the expected weather the next day were lovely additional touches. We thoroughly enjoyed using the lounges on the ground floor for super relaxing drinks before heading out for dinner - the local white wine was truly delicious! The hotal's location is pretty much perfect - it's located on a quiet square in a residential area, so it's quiet and a peaceful place to relax away from the crowds. However, it's only about ten minutes' walk from the Accademia, and maybe 15 minutes walk from the Duomo/Piazza Repubblicca etc., so provides the best of both worlds. The Regency isn't cheap - especially with today's euro/GBP exchange rate - but it is excellent value. If you can stretch to it, it's a romantic and intimate base from which to explore this beautiful city.
Reviews.Author: angelesque13

Reviews.Content: Quaint and Intimate in Florence The Regency is a small, charming hotel. It is away from the hustle and bustle of the city center, but only a short ten minute walk to the Duomo, etc. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Rooms are large, very clean and well appointed. Breakfast in the dining room (overlooking a lovely jewel box sized garden with outdoor seating) is very nice. If you are looking for an upscale, intimate hotel experience, this is the place for you. Florence has many hotel options, but Hotel Regency will allow you to feel as though you are far away from the city, even when you're not! For the price, location and intimate setting, Hotel Regency cannot be beat.
Reviews.Author: travelgirl521

Reviews.Content: Highly Recommend Have just returned from 3 nights at the Regency, beautiful hotel, excellent staff, a real gem.The hotel is situated about 10 - 15 minutes walk from the centre, overlooking a lovely piazza, a good chance to walk and digest some of the amazing food that the city has to offer.Our room was lovely, with a view over the gardens, we asked for a garden view and a dvd player and both requests were adhered to, the staff were very very helpful, helping us with the bookings for the Uffizi and Accademia saving the long queues.Would highly recommend this lovely hotel....
Reviews.Author: safaris63

Reviews.Content: A Very Good Hotel Myself and my wife booked this hotel via lastminute.com for an anniversary trip to Florence.This hotel is not 5 star quality - but it is a very good 4 star hotel. The staff were extremely helpful, and the room was nice and quiet with it's own minibar and safe.The garden area is to a very pleasant area to eat breakfast (we had to ask the waiter to set this up though, as they try to encourage you to stay inside)The food was good, and the hotel had a nice ambience. It was also a 10 minute walk to the centre - we actually enjoyed this, as most of Florence was very built up and busy.We left at 6 in the morning - the porter had already prepared coffee and juice for us (breakfast starts at 7.30). A nice touch.Only criticism - the minibar was very expensive. A bottle of water was 6.5 euro's, and only 36 cents in a nearby supermarket!.
Reviews.Author: York_TravellerYork

Reviews.Content: Wonderful, Inviting property This hotel has first class service and all of the staff were extremely accommodating and helpful. We staying in a room with a private balcony overlooking the park. The room was extremely large and comfortable. The breakfast had an excellent selection and eating in the private garden was a great way to start the day. I would highly recommend!
Reviews.Author: gwporsche

Reviews.Content: Good choice My husband and I just came back from a fantastic week end in Florence, and if the sites and museums were breathtaking, the hotel was rather good too. It was in a very quiet location, away from the buzz of the centre, but still within10min walk from the Academia, a bit more for the Uffizzi.So just a perfect location.The only bad note would be for the restaurant . The menu is very enticing, but does not live up to its promises. And very expensive too.But with so many restaurants in Florence, you can definitely enjoy the comfort of the hotel and the staff friendliness without testing the restaurant!December 2007
Reviews.Author: AlFa87

Reviews.Content: Great choice Stayed here for four nights in late September. Our room was quite large with many electrical outlets, and nice sized bathroom. The location was a great compromise--walking distance to just about everything but still in a quiet area. The park across the street had a lovely carousel and attracted locals with children and dogs--a great place to people watch for a while. The restaurant was excellent--although it is primarily for guests. Concierge was quite helpful and gave us a wonderful suggestion for a day trip to Lucca--about 1 1/2 hours away by train. I would definitely recommend this hotel!
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli

Reviews.Content: Very Pleasant My husband and I recently stayed at The Regency for three nights and had a very enjoyable stay. We received a very warm welcome as soon as we arrived and our room and its amenities were super (Room #405). The room was comfortable and had three small balconies that overlooked the park. The bathroom was big with nice toiletries (which were freshened daily), fluffy towels, and excellent water pressure. We enjoyed drinks in the garden courtyard and also had an excellent dinner at the hotel. Breakfast was fine and morning room service for coffee was always right on time and excellent.The concierge(s) were top notch and provided excellent restuarant reommendations (don't miss Leo's!) and private tours with the Mercurial group (excellent and small groups). Although the hotel was a slight walk from the downtown sights, it only took us at most ten minutes and the traffic was fine.The only possible negative, and it's hardly a complaint, is to separate the key pick up/drop off from the Concierge desk. There was a bit of a gridlock issue/interruption when speaking with the concierge. Overall, we had a wonderful stay in Florence and the Hotel Regency was part of the reason for this. We definitely recommend this hotel!
Reviews.Author: mguest

Reviews.Content: Most courteous and Helpful Staff My wife and I and another couple took advantage of the stay 7 nights at the Regency and 7 nights at the sister hotel Lord Byron in Rome, and pay for only ten nights. It turns out that both hotels are run remarkably well. The hotel is situated in a residential neighborhood only a short walk to the main sites. Our room was upgraded to a junior suite. It was very quiet and very comfortable.The concierges, Federico, and Aviti, were fully informed and always at service. The restaurant was excellent both for breakfast and supper. In particular our waiter Romano was out- standing. The hotel is kept meticulously by a caring staff. After a week in Florence we went to their sister hotel the Lord Byron situated in the upscale nieghborhood of Parioli just outside the Bourghese Gradens. Here were upgrade to suites that were quite large and equally quiet and the service by Claudia and Andrea at the front desk was outstanding. Kudos to Nicola at the bar. We will definitely return to both these hotels in the future.
Reviews.Author: NFLCHAMP

Reviews.Content: Royal treatment at the Regency I spent three wonderful nights at this hotel. It was not cheap at all, but the treatment received by all its personnel was outstanding. Its buffet breakfast was very good; its restaurant and the service was also excellent. The bill was not low, but with their friendly and helpful attitude their employees fully justified the charges. Wholeheartedly recommended.
Reviews.Author: andresG

Reviews.Content: Nice Choice in Florence My wife and I stayed at the Regency in July 2006 and enjoyed our short stay.Pros: Good, quiet location (despite what other reviews have said, within reasonable walking distance of most sites in Florence); friendly staff; good restaurant; clean.Cons: Although we had booked a non-smoking room, we were placed in a smoking room. When we contacted the hotel staff, rather than moving us to a different room, they sent housekeeping to clean the room again, which helped a bit, but not completely. They should simply have moved us a different room, which was not offered.
Reviews.Author: NETraveler64

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Deal Got a great deal including dinner for around 拢100 per night for a junior suite, great value for a 5*.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good, but not a 5 star by far The Regency is nice, but not a 5 star. More like a low 4 star by U.S. standards. Rooms are in the main bldg and a sort of annex bldg to the side. There is considerable road noise in the side bldg so I would check where your room is. We were moved to the main bldg and it was quiet. The hotel is quite a hike from the main tourist area/duomo (about 15-20min). The hike would be nice except the sidewalks are quite narrow and you can end up competiting with the traffic (a compeition that you will loose). The service is very good. The breakfast is okay (would not buy it if not included in the package). Both rooms had very old beds.
Reviews.Author: TwoHavlesofCoconuts

Reviews.Content: refined elegance and quiet A very quiet hotel a short walk from the major attractions. Good if you enjoy 5 star service without the noise and bustle of center city hotels. Staff were exceptionally helpful.
Reviews.Author: provi

Reviews.Content: Good location, but too pricey       The David
Reviews.Author: chipero

Reviews.Content: Excellent stay This is a small place where they remember you and look after you. We started our honeymoon here and loved it!
Reviews.Author: Whatever79

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, a bit far We stayed for three nights during the first week of May. Paid $220 USD per night. The hotel is about a 15-minute walk from the center of Florence. The concierge was friendly and helpful. The maid service was a bit annoying as they would try to open our door without knocking. Breakfast consisted or meats, cheeses and breads. The room was fantastic. Extremely spacious, beautifully decorated and well-kept. Bathroom was large and very clean. AC worked well.Overall, good experience. Would stay there again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A long walk from the attaractions ... and mediocre! We frequently visit hotels which are members of the Leading Hotels of the World, but the Regency is not up to the standard we have come to expect. Despite the hotel's claims to the contrary, it is at least a 20 to 30 minute walk to the main centre of Florence, and this involves perilous walks through narrow, ill-lit, and seedy streets with little room for both cars and pedestrians. The room was OK (apart from the water coming through the bathroom ceiling) and the staff were very helpful. However, the buffet breakfast was a joke - they can't even produce regular orange juice! - and the room service breakfast even worse. Next time, we'll try to find a more central hotel.
Reviews.Author: adamsfamilyhome

Reviews.Content: Understated elegance, truly outstanding! I recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Regency Hotel in February 2005. The hotel is located on a charming park, roughly 15 minutes by foot from the main attractions. The local neighborhood contains many wonderful, non-touristy restaurants and provides more of an authentic feel than the tourist city core. The walk to the core is very pleasant, but the hotel can quickly summon taxis if need be. We reserved 2 classic rooms, but were upgraded to 2 deluxe rooms which were loacted adjacent to each other on the top floor per our request. They were extremely clean, with charming decor, unique designer detail representative of a fine town house, outstanding linens, and large marble bathrooms. Each room also had small patios overlooking the adjacent park. Breakfast was included in the daily rate, which was very good. The hotels finest point was its staff. They were extremely kind, handled any request with poise, and provided thoughtful recommendations and reservations at a wide range of restaurants depending upon our mood. On the day of our departure, they contacted our hotel in Rome to ensure that our reservations were confirmed. In summary, a charming 5-star boutique-style hotel consistent with the standards of the LHW group. I could not imagine a finer way to visit Florence.
Reviews.Author: ToilsToTravel

Reviews.Content: Wonderful! Stayed 2 nights at the Regency in November 2003. My room was lovely. The bathroom was clean and spacious an dincluded lots of amenities. There was a nice closet and even a safe.Breakfast was included and wonderful. i found the staff very ehlpful with transportation and museum tickets.I highly recommend this hotel and its lovely staff.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fabulous My sister and I just returned from a trip to Florence where we stayed at the Hotel Regency. Our trip was amazing, thanks to the lovely staff of this hotel who consistently went out of their way to make us feel at home. After long days of sightseeing and intensive shopping, it was great to return to their warm smiles and our cosy room. The room was elegantly decorated, comfortable and most charming. The bathroom was clean, spacious, and most importantly, free of the periodic odd quirks characteristic of Italy鈥檚 bath facilities, five star hotel or not. To top everything off the room featured a great balcony where we enjoyed a fine glass of Italian wine as standard evening ritual. We would both go back in a heartbeat!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Overated We spent our Christmas at Hotel Regency this year, and we were disappointed in the overall offering. First, the room was tiny, not to mention the mediocre decoration. Second, our room was left unlocked after room cleaning (service key was left on the door knob.) Third, the bathroom was REALLY small. We understand the heritage tradition history behind this 1 century old hotel, but it is definitely not worth of $300 bucks.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
